value.title: Take Power BI data alerts to the next level with Microsoft Flow
value.excerpt: Patrick shows you how easy it is to use Microsoft Flow to take Power BI data alerts to the next level. Use Microsoft Flow to send to additional people. value.title: Using the SELECTEDVALUE function in DAX

value.title: Building relationships between tables when both have duplicates
value.excerpt: PowerPivot and Power BI Desktop only allow the creation of relationships between tables when one of columns forming the relationship does not have duplicate values. value.title: Dynamic labels in Power BI using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick uses a little DAX, and the SelectedValue function, to get you some dynamic labels in your Power BI reports.  For more information about SelectedValue, check out Marco Russo's blog on the function - https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/using-the-selectedvalue-function-in-dax/  LET'S CONNECT!

value.title: Easily get an access token for the Power BI Embedded Playground
value.excerpt: You need an Embed Token for the Power BI Embedded Playground, but you don't want to write code. Adam shows you how to easily get an access token with no code using PowerShell.  Power BI Embedded Playground - https://microsoft.github.io/PowerBI-JavaScript/demo/ Power BI REST API - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/power-bi/

value.title: Embed a dashboard from Power BI into your application
value.excerpt: In this video, I go over the embed a dashboard sample and walk you through how to actually embed a dashboard into your application. This uses a combination of the Power BI REST APIs and the JavaScript API.  Embed Dashboards in Your Applications to Monitor Your Business in Context (Blog) - https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/embed-dashboard/
